website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive alternative that rides high on the leg but keeps feet warm in cold weather. There may be some fit problems.
pros: Easy for kids to pull on and off
A lightweight option, which means your child won't get fatigued as fast
cons: They run small, which can make sizing difficult
Snow pants have a hard time fitting over the tall shaft
Sizes for older kids tend to be out of stock

customer_reviews.title: NOT waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: These leaked the first time my son stepped into a puddle 😡
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Slocum

customer_reviews.title: Right where the rubber foot meets the canvas upper there is a rubber seam the sticks out pretty far into the inner boot - right at the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 3 year old son in size 8. Tough getting his feet in and he screamed and stomped until I took them off. He said they hurt and he’s not usually picky about his feet. The felt insert does not come fully together in the front of the boot allowing part of the inside unfinished boot to touch the leg. Right where the rubber foot meets the canvas upper there is a rubber seam the sticks out pretty far into the inner boot - right at the bend of foot to chin. I’m wondering if this is what caused so much discomfort for him. Returned and ordered Tundra boots which he had and loved but out grew.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: The Wide boot is not the same as the regular Kamik Rocket
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great but be aware that the wide boots have different liners than the regular boots. The regular Kamik Rocket boot has a thicker liner that gives the boot a -40 rating. These boot have a thinner liner with a -20 rating. It appears that what Kamik did was use the same outer boot with a thinner liner to make more room for a wider foot.
customer_reviews.author: F. Kowalonek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Michigan Winters
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. My son wears a 13 little boys size shoe and that’s what I got and they fit perfect with room to grow with thick socks. Great quality! Rated for -40 degrees. Not tested at that temperature but they kept my son’s feet warm and dry! I purchased Lands End brand last year and he came home every day with wet feet. I bought these mid winter last year and was so happy that I am buying them again for this winter. I was happy with the draw string to cinch them in to keep snow from entering the top!
customer_reviews.author: s1908

customer_reviews.title: One Trip Boots
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these boots for both my 4 year old son and 2 year old son for our ski trip. PROS: They shipped on time and they are cute boots. CONS: They are a bit bulky, but my kids both walked fine in them, my youngest tripped a few times but that can be expected. The biggest disappointment was when I took them off they were wet inside, I thought it might be sweat, but when I took the inserts out you could see the wetness in the bottom of the boot. My kids never complained, so they at least did the trick for this trip, but will be ordering a different brand for the next one.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Not good for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: First off, I ordered a whole size up. I took the insert out to see how it fit his foot, it was way to tight and narrow, the top of his "foot pudge" was being pinched by the V in the top of the insert. They resembled tiny little elf shoes, a very weird shape and not made with chubby toddler feet in mind. These boots were so awkward, I even had a hard time shoving the insert back in all by itself, much less with a foot in it. We went with Kamiks snowbug 3 instead and we're much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Layla

customer_reviews.title: Two left shoes, one is a knock off.
customer_reviews.text: Planned to have these shoes before our first snow storm tomorrow. When they arrived, they sent two very similar, but not identical, LEFT boots. No right boot. One appears to be some kind of a knock off. One has a small, thin insole that is black and the other insole is thicker and orange, and the velcro strap goes the wrong direction on the weird shoe. Very disappointed my toddler won’t have his snow boots for the storm tomorrow. I purchased a pair last year for my older son in a different size and color. Those were correct shoes and looked like they were supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for children
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for our 9 year old son. The fit is good, keeps the rain/snow off, his feet stay dry. The negative is, the snow sticks to the bottom of the boots like glue. It prevents him to walk safely. I remove the snow for him and it glues at the bottom immediately, making it slippery and uneven heights. It is not safe for our 9 year old to walk on the ground once he is away from the snowy ground. I purchased this in October, the return window closed in November, the snow came in December, we can not return it, wish I could.
customer_reviews.author: Proman @startrektimelines

customer_reviews.title: The boot liner is VERY narrow
customer_reviews.text: These boots are cute looking but so poorly made. I wish I could return them but unfortunately missed the return deadline. I bought these for my 2.5 yr old who is a size 7. I bought size 8 to have extra room for thick socks. In any event the liner is so small and SO narrow - My daughters feet are small and relatively narrow but the liner doesn't even fit her foot - such terrible quality. If someone from Kamik could contact me to return these I would really appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: marley

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Boots!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice boots! They are a size to small but i am saving them for my other Daughter to wear. They are just to nice to return. The color is nice and bright and the boots are very well made. I am sure the boots will keep my Daughter's feet warm and dry this coming winter. Definetly, will consider ordering more of these in the future. Just make sure the sizing is right. The nice thing for me is if something is to small for my 10 Year old... i can store them for my 7 Year old. Works out Everytime!! :)
customer_reviews.author: SuperMommy

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size 1W for my 7 year old (ordered them for cheap this summer). She currently wears size 1 shoes but is in a 13 Sorel boot. I asked her to try the Sorel on one foot and the Kamik on the other, and she could barely get the Kamik on. She says there's nowhere for her pinky toe to go. Now they're past the date where they're eligible for return, and they're brand new with tags on them.... not happy.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift list fulfilled
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to give for a Christmas gift for a little boy I hardly know. Fulfilling a holiday wish list for a organization I volunteer for. I don’t know if it will fit but they do look weather proof and for a toddler sturdy and supportive. I also think they are adorable for the size. All my hopes that these boots will make this little boys Christmas a great one.
customer_reviews.author: Jak

customer_reviews.title: Just order up two sizes... nice boot!
customer_reviews.text: Luckily I read the reviews about size and bought this boot two sizes up from my daughter's tennis shoe size. They are perfect with about an inch left over to get her through the year. We had no issues putting them on, I'm guessing those who did just had too small of a size with the sizing issue. Glad to have no zippers and the boots are tall to keep the snow out. Update: we just got our first wet sloppy snow of the year, my daughter was outside for hours in the wet snow and her boots stayed dry inside! I'm updating my review to 5 stars warm, dry and a great value... out weigh the sizing issue!
customer_reviews.author: AJTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Keeps feet warm and dry.
customer_reviews.text: My ten year old loves these boots because they keep his feet warm and dry. We live in the cold Midwest and get plenty of annual snowfall for him to play in. He also wears them to walk to school and back and has never complained about their comfort. This is his second pair of Kamik boots and we couldn’t be happier with their performance.
customer_reviews.author: ninjafly

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots
customer_reviews.text: Kamik boots are fantastic. My son loves these boots. Fit was as expected. And they're nice and warm! Hoping to get another season of use out of them before he grows out. But they're nice and tough so regardless they'll get passed along to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get on
customer_reviews.text: Easy to get on. Velcro strap tightens at ankle, along with tie at top to keep snow out. Lower part of boot is water proof. Warm and comfortable. Inner lining comes out too... which can be warmed up in the dryer before going outside to keep your feet extra warm. My son loves these.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cold-weather Snow Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a big kid size 4 for my 9-yr-old son. He currently wears a size 3 sneaker, but I wanted the boots to be roomy for thick socks and so he won't outgrow them by the end of the season. They're perfect! They provide a nice, snug fit around the calf with an elastic cord that can be tightened at the top and Velcro straps to tighten near the ankles. I'm very pleased with the quality, appearance, and functionality of these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Jelane

customer_reviews.title: Keep feet warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I remember growing up having to put bags over our socks before we put our boots on and our feet would still be soaked after playing outside. This is the third year in a row we’ve bought these for our four year old because no matter how long we’re outside in the New England winters, her feet are always warm and dry when we come inside and the boots are never soaked! I don’t think we’ll ever buy a different pair of winter boots for our kids. I did get them in a wide fit because when she’s bundled up, they’re a lot easier to get on, but they’re true to size. They’re so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: CraigB

customer_reviews.title: much better boots than what you can buy at Wal mart ...
customer_reviews.text: much better boots than what you can buy at Wal mart or such. After going thru several sets of those, we bought a pair of these and have been buying each size up for our daughter and passing them on to our younger son. Two active winters and the outer boot has still got at least another year in it. After two years the liners are getting thin. If we had a 3rd child I'd buy a new set of those and get another year or two from these boots. Stop looking and buy the Kamiks.
customer_reviews.author: J. Krzystofiak

customer_reviews.title: Warm but not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: While warm (4.5 year old no longer complains about his feet feeling cold) they are not waterproof above the rubber and he often gets his feet wet if he is in slush. Bogs are better for that as I and my toddler have them and never get wet feet.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B.

customer_reviews.title: Warm and durable boots for active kids
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of Kamik's I've bought for my son. They are great boots and he plays in the snow with them a lot. They fit great. Easy on and off. And they keep my son's feet nice and warm. The boots also hold up well so my second son should be able to use them once my older son outgrows them. I will continue to order Kamik's in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa98

customer_reviews.title: Warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: These are great! We were out in the snow for a few hours (Colorado mountains) and they kept my sons feet warm and dry the entire time. The liner does make it so that you can only wear thin socks, but that is not a big deal. He can get them on and off by himself and tighten the top and bottom - which are key to help the boot fit better and keep the snow out.
customer_reviews.author: Babymomma

customer_reviews.title: Kamik Fan!
customer_reviews.text: I really like Kamik boots for my son. The removable lining is great for drying the boots out when needed and the adjustable top pull string helps to keep the snow from getting in there while playing in deep snow. I'm also thrilled to have found it for $38 on amazon. Prices may come down certain times of the year. I bought ours in December. I'm definitely a Kamik Fan!
customer_reviews.author: NYPfeif

customer_reviews.title: Too Small UGH!
customer_reviews.text: These were too small. I read all the reviews and everyone said they fit to size. Well that was not the case for my kids. I purchased 1 size of from what they were today - so there was room for growth and they were not even close to fitting her. I was able to use them for my younger daughter since the ones I bought for her were not even close to fitting her. So in the end - I bought 2 sizes larger and they fit my youngest.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle Martin

customer_reviews.title: and I usually buy them because the quality is good and they last/withstand the winter elements here in Minnesota
customer_reviews.text: This is my son's 3rd pair of Kamik boots, and I usually buy them because the quality is good and they last/withstand the winter elements here in Minnesota. However, this pair seems to give my son various blisters on the fronts and backs of his legs, behind his ankle and the tops/fronts of his shins. He doesnt wear them super tight, and I've never had a problem with Kamik boots before, so I'm not sure what is going on with these.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Scholl

customer_reviews.title: Solid kids snow boo
customer_reviews.text: Solid kids snow boot. Great value for the price. It keeps the kids feet dry and warm. We have been repress buyers of this product as the kids have grown and are often giving them to others to enjoy after multiple seasons of use.
customer_reviews.author: WG

customer_reviews.title: Great boot but Size 2 runs small. Wears a size 1 shoe
customer_reviews.text: I buy this boot every year for my girl in a bigger size. These boots are warm and the best thing is the liner is removable for drying. She currently wears a size 1 shoe so I got a 2. Still too small. Reordering a size 3.
customer_reviews.author: svt

customer_reviews.title: Elastic rope-like strap at top broke early
customer_reviews.text: The boots are usually great but this time the thin rope-like stretchy strap that pulls at the top of the boot broke on one boot. I think it came apart from inside the back where it was attached. And these boots are only about a month old. This very disappointing because now the snow just falls into the top and inside the boots.These boots are too expensive to have something like this happen : (
customer_reviews.author: Kris Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is our second pair of Kamik boots and we have loved them. The quality is great
customer_reviews.text: We live in the Rocky Mountains, and our kids go out for recess at school every day, unless its below 15 degrees. This is our second pair of Kamik boots and we have loved them. The quality is great, they keep our sons feet dry and warm, and they're easy for him to put on and take off on his own. Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them
customer_reviews.text: I was super impressed with the quality of these boots. Bought for boys ages 9 and 8. They wear these even when there's no snow, with and without socks. They would not wear these so much if they didn't really like them. Trust me, they're fussy kids
customer_reviews.author: Nutmegger Yankee

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for a great price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (8 years) loves these. There were no, “non girly” color options do she picked out these. They keep her feet warm and dry and dye has no trouble getting them on and off on her own.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Far too narrow
customer_reviews.text: My 10-year-old daughter normally wears a size 2 or 3 shoe, depending on the cut, manufacturer, etc. Her feet are not particularly wide; we've never had to go with a wide size in the past. She's still wearing (and loving) size 2 Kenneth Cole boots I ordered from Amazon over a year ago. We ordered these Kamik snow boots in size 3, knowing that too it's usually better to go too big than too small when ordering online. As soon as she put them on, she said they pinched both sides of both feet. They're far too narrow through the arch/middle. We'll be returning them and trying again with a different maunfacturer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Order a size smaller than foot measures and keep these for years!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are fantastic for kids, especially those with narrow feet. The velcro strap can be cinched tight to keep narrow heels in the boot snuggly. They are very easy to get on and off, even young kids can manage these on their own. BE AWARE: these are sized LARGE -- my son measures a size 4, but the size 3 fits with plenty of room at the toe. This pair replaces a pair of size 1 boots that my son wore for more than 2 years! Note: the size 1 was beginning to be snug in the toe for a foot that measures a size 4. Order at least one size lower than your child's foot measures!
customer_reviews.author: E. McGuire

customer_reviews.title: These appear to be well-made boots. I listened to ...
customer_reviews.text: These appear to be well-made boots. I listened to other reviews and bought a size bigger, however the insert is really thick and sewn up very narrow. I took the inserts out and made sure the boots fit and they were plenty big enough, it was the insert that his foot wouldn’t fit in. I had to take a pair of scissors and cut the stitching of the insert so his foot would fit. Then I shoved the insert back into the boot, and it fit perfectly. I only gave 4 stars for this reason. My son does have fat feet, though.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Epperly

customer_reviews.title: Not well designed for a child's foot to get into.
customer_reviews.text: This is a poorly designed boot. It seems right but my child has size 11 feet and I. Bought a size 12 to allow some growth and use of extra socks for additional warmth. When I went to use the boot at the first snowfall I couldn't even get my sons foot into the boot. He was wincing as I tried repeatedly. Since it had been 35 days since I purchased it I had to pay a "restocking fee" of 20% to be able to return them. Grrrrr
customer_reviews.author: Carrie/Kurt Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: I ordered these in my kids' regular size, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in my kids' regular size, but they both complained that they were way too tight around their foot & they were very difficult for them to pull on. When I tried to exchange them for a larger size, the price had gone up considerably, so I ended up getting the Kamik Kids' Snobuster1 in a size larger than they usually wear. Those worked out perfectly for us.
customer_reviews.author: fanny119

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and well made
customer_reviews.text: Just as warm and waterproof as our other Kamik boots! I ordered a size too big in hopes of getting two seasons out of these so being able to tighten the black strap helps them still fit very well.
customer_reviews.author: The Biker Lady

customer_reviews.title: Third year getting these boots, awesome quality
customer_reviews.text: These are our go-to boots for the South Dakota winter. Keeps toes nice and warm, easy to put on as well. Have held up great over the winter with no issues. Sizing is perfect. If you want to get 2 seasons worth (or wear thicker socks) size up.
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: First wear in -10 and kids toes cold
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed.. My 11 year old told me his toes were cold the other morning when it was only -10 (I thought it was beautiful!) I went out to shovel snow and drink my coffee the kids ended up joining me. He wasn't still, constantly moving... I wasn't even wearing socks with my boots.. He was wearing wool! I'd like an explanation when the tag said -40. Because I also purchased a pair for my toddler...
customer_reviews.author: Angelina g.

customer_reviews.title: 10$ in the hole....
customer_reviews.text: My toddler boy wears 7/8 shoe. I ordered a Kamik size 8 and had it next day delivered because of the extreme cold we are currently going through (MN). The boots were so tight we could not get them on his feet. My wife and I felt something inside, maybe plastic, constricting around the liner but I was not going to try and pull out since I knew they has to go back. And shipping back to Amazon was about 6$. And, for the kicker, I went to Fleet Farm where they had the same exact boot on sale for 24.99 not $44.99 on Amazon but, in the end, I went with a Sorel and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Road08

customer_reviews.title: half size up
customer_reviews.text: I would buy half size bigger, since the removable liner makes it a bit tighter. Nice boots, haven't tested yet in snow.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot. Runs small.
customer_reviews.text: Seem to run one full size too small. My Daughter wears a size 7 1/2 or 8 women’s she or girls/youth 7. The size 7 girls boot was about one full size too small. Otherwise the quality was good. A little boxy at the top but there is a draw string.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe addict

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the boot is good, and I have purchased Kamiks previously for both ...
customer_reviews.text: They were too small for my son and had to be returned. My son has wide feet, so he has limited options. The quality of the boot is good, and I have purchased Kamiks previously for both my son and daughter. The return process was smooth. No problems with the product, just didn't work for us this time. It's the risk I took buying shoes for a kid with wide feet via the internet.
customer_reviews.author: NH Mom

customer_reviews.title: Buy before the winter, great boots
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying Kamik boots for our family for many years, and are extremely satisfied with the quality of the product. It's a family owned company that's been around for over a 100 years. I give these boots my highest recommendation. They are of excellent quality and are very durable. They fit well and the kids like wearing them. Buy them, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: val321

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots but the liner is just somewhat small. The boots are wide enough but my son has to now wear them without the liner. It really is making me question if I'll buy the next size. Now that it's middle of winter, nothing is on sale and so I can't see spending even more money on the next size. His sneakers are 6W and they still fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: A Strong Poet

customer_reviews.title: Like Them, But Sizing Was Difficult
customer_reviews.text: We haven't tested these in the snow yet as they are intended for an upcoming ski trip. What I will say is they seem really well constructed and seem like they will be warm. The sizing was a bit difficult though. Based on reviews, I ordered a size up (8) for my almost 2 year-old (who wears 6/7) and I couldn't fit his feet in the inner liners. So I returned for a size 9 and they seem really big...We are going to keep the 9s, make them work and hope they still fit next year.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie Tregilgas

customer_reviews.title: Great boots but definitely size up
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots but I would definitely size up. My daughter wears a size 7 and I purposely bought these one size bigger (toddler 8) so she could have room to grow or wear thick socks but they have no room to grow. The 8 is not tight but if I had purchased her true size (size 7) they definitely would've been. We like them a lot and are keeping them because they are very warm and durable. She just won't be able to wear them next year.
customer_reviews.author: Lore A.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots for my 3rd grade son who is not hard on boots. His last two pair have lasted two winters each. These barely made it two months before the elastic tightener broke. Without being able to tighten the top closed the boot remains open like a bucket, filling with snow and falling off easily. Tried Kamik, going back to Columbia.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great material
customer_reviews.text: We have not tried these out in the snow yet but the material feels great. Now my kid wears a size 5.5/6 in shoes. Since they didn't have a 6.5 i went w a 7 and it fiys great with an inch of breathing room. My son loves them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dragon Lover 01

customer_reviews.title: Nice snow boots
customer_reviews.text: My Granddaughter loves these boots. Warmest part of her body playing in the snow she says. Fit true to size. Loves the purple color...matches her coat perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on
customer_reviews.text: These boots are a complete joke. There is no strap to loosen the top making it impossible to get a foot into the bottom of the boot. Moreover the liner is incredibly tight making it even harder to fit the foot. Runs two sizes to small. I doubt an adult could get into this model of boot, much less a figety infant or toddler. Getting in to a ski boot is a cup of tea compare to these. Don't waste your money on these
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas McTyre

customer_reviews.title: High quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. Solid construction. Our 4th year buying this brand of boot for our grandson. Excellent quality. Worth the $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality snow boots!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best snow boots! I get them every year for my son who is now 6 years old. They fit true to size and keep his feet very warm and dry even in last winter's extremely cold and snowy weather (we live in NJ). He has gone out in wind chills below zero and played in 2 feet of snow and when he came in his feet were totally dry and actually WARM when I touched his feet after I pulled these boots off. They are the best snow boot for kids....and adults! If they came in my size, I would buy them for myself! Highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: AnnMarie

customer_reviews.title: Kamik rocks
customer_reviews.text: I buy Kamik Rocket boots for my boys' whenever they outgrow their current ones. They've never let me down. No leaks and have held up through two rough boys. Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: The Judge

customer_reviews.title: Don’t chance a lesser boot.
customer_reviews.text: For all the complaining kids can do, it isn’t about these boots or cold feet. Well worth it. Durable enough for several kids.
customer_reviews.author: Guenther

customer_reviews.title: Sizing!!??
customer_reviews.text: We bought these considering the great rating. I am not certain if we got a pair with a defect but the liners were incredibly small. I bought these 2 full sizes larger than my toddlers shoes. Our toddler is very small for the age, and we couldn't get the liners on his feet. For sizing comparison, the Toddler Size 8 would not fit a tablespoon in width wise in the foot piece of the liner. Not sure how any toddler's foot would actually fit in these?
customer_reviews.author: JN193147

customer_reviews.title: Nice Big Red Boots
customer_reviews.text: Ok so this is a big boot is comfy but big, my son is 8 and it comes up past his calf and u cant fit jeans over it so u must always wear the boot over the pant legs. The red is very bright red so be careful when color selecting make sure u get a pair that matches ur coat at least.the inserts are removable and washable, I suggests removing them from time to time to clean them and make sure they are dry. My son likes them and the sizing is well he has room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: straightshooter

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever for wide/tall big boys feet
customer_reviews.text: My kid insisted that I leave a five star review for these boots! He is a big guy with wide, tall feet that loves wet cold weather, but hates to fuss with his boots. These are the only boots I’ve found that come in 7W, which is a tough size in between big kids and men’s shoes that many brands don’t seem to cover, let alone in a wide size. These keep his feet warm and dry and actually fit!
customer_reviews.author: Angelika Kinneman

customer_reviews.title: Can't love it as I open the package and see threading ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't love it as I open the package and see threading loose. I expect no strings to be loose when they are a new item. But they do look sturdy and warm and my son loves them. We need them for one season so I will keep them but am disappointed by the lack of attention to detail. Also on one of the soles it looks a bit worn in one spot. Did I pay for a new item or is it really just refurbished or someone else's return? Signed, A Concerned Shopper
customer_reviews.author: Jenny D

customer_reviews.title: Favorite kids boot
customer_reviews.text: Kamik is my favorite kids boot. I have yet to get a pair that leaks or is hard to get on and off for little hands. They can be pricey though, so I generally try to buy them in late summer while I can still get them on sale.
customer_reviews.author: StoneHenge

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Always do well with Kamik. Havent had problem yet so I would recommend. Stepson loves them.
customer_reviews.author: RjVZ

customer_reviews.title: Not wide width.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. I ordered an 8W. The box says 8W, but the boots and boot liners say 8. They didn’t even get on her feet until I took out the liners. She will have to wear them without the liners.
customer_reviews.author: singlemom

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful boots, but run VERY small
customer_reviews.text: I tried a similar pair of Kamik boots on my toddler at a local store in the same size (I think they were the Waterbug variety) and then ordered these assuming they would fit him. WRONG! I literally couldn't even get his foot into these. I pulled out the inner liner to see exactly how they weren't fitting, and they were extremely narrow. I was really disappointed because they are obviously well-made and super-warm boots. For reference, he wears about a 7 or 7.5 in most shoes, and I ordered these in an 8.
customer_reviews.author: Hones

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my daughter. She wears a size 13, so I thought I'd be safe getting size 1. They are really snug on her feet :( Quality of Kamik boots are great though!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product Amazed us
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter her 6th Grade school camp. First day during her hiking she felt that little heavier then her usual sneakers but from the second day onward this was the one protected her being wet from Snow , water streams etc. while on her hike to bear mountains.. We are happy and 100% satisfied customers. Thanks Kamik for the best Quality
customer_reviews.author: SureshRaj

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. I live in Utah, and the cheap boots from our local stores just weren't holding up well enough for my 9 year old son. I got him these and they are fabulous. His feet stay dry, they actually have traction on the bottom (and the soles made it through last winter and still look great). Definitely a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Not wide at all
customer_reviews.text: My son has wide feet, so I was really hoping these would fit. I had to remove the lining to get his feet in them, so now he wears thick wool socks with them. I wish they had a zipper. My son is only 2, so he's not into cooperating with putting them on. They are very difficult to put on because of the long shaft. Next time, I'll buy boots with a zipper!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E

customer_reviews.title: Perfect winter boot for an active kid
customer_reviews.text: Tried these on and fit perfect. My 8 year old can do all the hard work (pull them on, pull the draw cord, pull the velcro) without my help. The reason one star was off was that the velcro, when pulled, is longer than the matching piece on the boot to strap to. That means there is a bit of extra material "flapping" about. I would recommend the boots based on the appearance of durable material and sizing. Size ordered was young kid size 1 (after 13.5).
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: These boots are made for happy little feet
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be perfect. At least my grandson thinks so...wore them till bedtime the afternoon they arrived and to school the next day though we aren't quite to snow season yet. ❄
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: I am really disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: the liners in these boots make it impossible to get their foot in them. my grand daughter is growing out of a toddler 13 so I purchased a little kids size 1. She couldn't even get her foot down into the boot so they have been returned. I am really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mammasawnT

customer_reviews.title: Great snow boots for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Comfortable and durable. They hold up to a hard day of outdoor play.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for on & off again use
customer_reviews.text: We live in VT and get quite a bit of snow therefore, snow boots are kind of part of our "winter uniform." These boots fit the bill because they are easy to get off and on and my 3 year old can do it himself. He's never once complained that his feet are cold when we spend HOURS playing outside in 0-5o temps. They're a little pricey for a toddler shoe since he'll likely get less than one season out of them, but worth it for the warmth and ease of use. The best we've tried!
customer_reviews.author: SoCal614

customer_reviews.title: These are great boots quality wise but the liner is so skinny ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots quality wise but the liner is so skinny my grandson and granddaughter could not get them on. I'd much rather they did not have a removable liner.Sending these back.
customer_reviews.author: placasse

customer_reviews.title: Still looks new after a winter in Montana!
customer_reviews.text: These guys make a quality boot in Canada! My kid was running around in the snow and slush all winter and they cleaned up super easy! Just take out the nice felt liner and spray and brush off the boot under the sink in warm water. After a season on the mountain and in town, they still look new. The rubber does not wear down and crack like cheap chinese boots. Buy them BIG! Socks will fill up the space and you can get two seasons out of them this way! Use a thinner wool sock on the second season!
customer_reviews.author: Lenka

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awesome! They keep my sons feet dry and warm and are nice and flexible. I would totally recommend these. I find they run true to size for my son. He wears a 4.5 shoe so I bought the 5 and he has some room to grow in there but not too much.
customer_reviews.author: K. Haro

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit for a wide boot.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are suppose to be a wide boot. There is nothing on the boot stating that they are wide, but that's how they are described on Amazon. My son is getting use to them, but at first he complained of them feeling too tight in the toe box area. Otherwise they seem to be keeping his feet warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I really liked it, but had to return because it runs small. But very good quality. Wanted to buy bigger size, but it was out of stock
customer_reviews.author: Aigerima T

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this product if your kid has wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I ordered size 10 wide. It is one size bigger than what we usually buy for our son. He has wide feet and I thought it would be better if we order these boots in size wide and one size up. When boots arrived they looked so small and narrow. I got even more upset when I saw the lining. It is very narrow and makes it impossible to put these boots on. Very disappointed. Stay away from this product !
customer_reviews.author: Erik Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair last year and I just love them. We bought this pair for my 7 year old son and they are very nice. Comfortable, easy to put on and take off with no hands and very warm.
customer_reviews.author: JFINN

customer_reviews.title: These are really nice sturdy snowboots
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice sturdy snowboots. We haven't gotten to test them out in the snow yet, but they have done a good job of keeping our guy's feet warm in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE kAMIK BOOTS AND LOVE THEM AND HAVE BEEN WEARING THEM FOR THREE YEARS KEEP MY FEET WARM SO i GOT MY GRANDSON A PAIR AND HE LOVES THEM
customer_reviews.author: Marsha R. DiRienzo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but sizing is off.
customer_reviews.text: The boots seem to be good quality but the sizing is totally off. I ordered a 9 for my boy who wears size 8 just to be sure. We couldn't even get his foot into the liner. The boots seem like good quality but the sizing is an issue. We ordered a different Kamik boot in size 9 and it easily slid on his foot.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the amount of snow we get in North ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute and durable. Perfect for the amount of snow we get in North Carolina. The strap across the ankle along with the pull tie at the top help to keep ice and snow from getting down into the boots. I will probably order the next size up next winter. This pair lasted 2 seasons and we are happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Saka

customer_reviews.title: Only buy Kamiks for my son
customer_reviews.text: Kamik boots are wonderful for you children. They are very lightweight, durable and keeps them dry/warm. These are the 4th pair he's owned and they are equally as great.
customer_reviews.author: K.P.

customer_reviews.title: Cozy & Dry
customer_reviews.text: Best boots for kids! The hard soles can be tough to walk in and they are kinda heavy, but a small price to pay for warm dry feet. These do seem to be truly waterproof and cozy in single digit (below zero windchills) weather.
customer_reviews.author: EBB

customer_reviews.title: Warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old son gets cold very easy. We went to a3 day ice fishing tournament and his boots never got wet on the inside and his feet stayed warm the entire trip
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: Good snow boot
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my son and they are great. Easy to put on and they keep his feet dry.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rostege

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent boots that do a wonderful job keeping the kids ...
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent boots that do a wonderful job keeping the kids warm as they play much longer in the snow than I would have preferred to have been exposed to winter temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: C. Slocum

customer_reviews.title: Good boots, good price
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a high quality boot, keeps my daughter's feet warm. My son has had the same ones in black for a year now, still holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: J Williams

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with the pink boots
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a year ago for a snow trip with my 10yr old. She wears them now to play outside to keep from getting her shoes muddy and wet. They're comfortable and hold up well in the snow, mud, and in puddles. Good price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Kamik
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. You can't beat this brand for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi M.

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: My kids have been wearing Kamik boots for years. Typically their boots last 2 seasons before they grow out of them. It keeps their feet dry and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Butterbug's Mom

customer_reviews.title: We are on our second winter with these with our ...
customer_reviews.text: We are on our second winter with these with our second child. They hold up amazingly. We got them for our son and now our daughter has them, they are a little big for her but with layered socks it will not be a problem. Both of my kids can put them on and take them off without assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra D

customer_reviews.title: Very insulated
customer_reviews.text: My son loves boots and he really enjoys this pair. I cannot wait for it to snow this year so that he can get some more use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: kandis stewart

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, warm all great!
customer_reviews.text: OMG we love these boots! Son is 6 and ordered size 1M I think, him being size 13 in regular shoes. Everything is great about them, they are tall and we like it. Warm etc., we live in WI and these are great!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son loves his boots and is able to put them on and take them off himself. He's sad that it's no longer boot season but I sized up, hoping they'll still fit next year. If not, baby brother will wear them eventually. We moved up from baby Bogs to these this past winter as our son enjoys stomping in the snow and we needed something taller that would cinch closed. These were worth the money and they have enough life left in them for several more children!
customer_reviews.author: shyviolet

customer_reviews.title: Best boots for my money
customer_reviews.text: I buy these boots every year for my grandsons. Good to -40, very durable and come in many colors. They have never failed my expectations. I am confident they have warm and dry feet when they go out in our harsh New Hampshire winter. It was already only 7 degrees on November 13th with 3 inches of new snow!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and easy to slip on. Warm warm warm.. even in 10 degree weather with feels like -15 temps. Tromping thru snow for 5 hours, my daughter’s feet were still warm!
customer_reviews.author: Stan S.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Loved the way the liner can be removed to dry
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Wittrien

customer_reviews.title: Fit is tight
customer_reviews.text: I would go up a size only because the liner tends to make the fit tighter. The tighter the boot the colder the feet will be...
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Page

product_meta.title: Kamik Rocket Cold Weather Boot (Toddler/Little Kid/Big Kid)
product_meta.description:
A quick cinch and your little one is out the door in this basic weatherproof snow boot from Kamik. The Rocket features a bungee cord snow collar and a hook-and-loop band over the foot for an easy adjustable fit. A thermal insole, removable moisture-wicking liner, and waterproof bottom with lug outsole keep kids warm, dry, and comfortable as they tramp through the snow and slush.

A quick cinch and your little one is out the door in this basic weatherproof snowboot from Kamik. The Rocket features a bungee cord snow collar and a hook-and-loop band over the foot for an easy adjustable fit. A thermal insole, removable moisture-wicking liner, and waterproof bottom with lug outsole keep kids warm, dry, and comfortable as they tramp through the snow and slush.

Kamik comes from a place of extremes. Where the harshest conditions intersect with some of the most beautiful sights you'll ever see. At Kamik, we make footwear that brings to life our northern origins. Singular. Strong. Simply dependable. We've been doing it for over 100 years. Day after day. 24/7. The result of all this effort: a complete line of outdoor footwear built to deliver superior comfort and reliable protection in the most extreme conditions. We know you wouldn't have it any other way.

See more
feature_bullets: 600 denier nylon and synthetic nubuck upper
Adjustable snow collar with Easy-Grab Lace Lock and adjustable mid-foot hook and loop strap
8 mm Zylex removable liner (97% recycled content)
